John Cena should have lost. booker t would make a better us champion. 7/102) Luther Reigns vs Charlie Hass. this match was so boring. the only thing thta was happening was charlie hass getting the tar bettin out of him. luther is so boring. 4/103) Rey Mysterio vs Chavo Guerro. this was a really great match. Bringing Mordecai into the wwe was one of the stupidest decision ever made by the wwe. hardcore holly is a great wrestler but just like in said about billy gunn it is impossile to work a good match with Mordecai. 4/107)Texas Bull Rope Match. Eddie Guerro vs JBL. i love the matches Eddie and JBL put on. they are really entertaining but putting them in a texas bull rope match is a really stupid idea. nontheless this was a good match. there Judgment Day match was a lot better. 8/108)Dudley Boyz vs Undertaker. this was so stupid. it wasnt even a match. reviewText: Spike Dudley VS Jamie Noble: This was the match on Heat, it serves a purpose to warm up the crowd. Do check out this extra match because it's much better then half the stuff you'll see on the PPV.John Cena VS RVD VS Booker T VS Rene Dupree: This is one of the worst fatal four-way matches i've ever witnessed. Two men fight in the ring and two men look on from the outside. RVD oversells a frog splash, I dont know if he was sick or injuried but it was overkill. The match was really boring but the one-on-one match between Cena-Booker went well for a brief few minutes.Luther Reigns VS Charlie Haas: Angle is upset that Haas has become soft. His new bodyguard needs a match on the PPV, so you know what that means. Not a bad match but nothing i'd ever watch again. Reigns finisher looked impressive but botched.Rey Mysterio VS Chavo Guerrero: A very long match, probably the longest match between these two men. Good match and the final two minutes are awesome.Billy Gunn VS Kenzo Suzuki: I wonder why Kenzo never made it in WWE. Watch this match and you'll see why. Kenzo is very sloppy and cant direct a match. This was one of the worst PPV matches of this decade i've ever witnessed, hell it almost put me to sleep. Avoid this one at all cost.Torrie Wilson VS Sable: SkipMordecai VS Hardcore Holly: Anyone remember Mordecai? Mordecai was put on the shelf after this match and sent to WWE's minor leagues. He returned as Kevin Fertig/Kevin Thorne. I will admit Holly did look good in some matches but this is not one of them. Mordecai wins with a razor edge type maneuver and rides off into the sunset for a few years.JBL VS Eddie Guerrero: This match was decent, I really dont like the stipulation. JBL wins the world title in controversy, much like his entire run as champion. See Eddie jumped over JBL to tag the final corner but JBL lands on it first. Angle is wheeled up to explain to Eddie what happend. I do like Eddie's reaction to losing. Overall, a decent match.Side Note: Hogan, Triple H, The Rock, Steve Austin were some of the great wrestler who held the world title in the beginning of the decade. Triple H held the belt in 02-03 and beat everyone in site with the help of a sledgehammer or Ric Flair. JBL had wild, out of control, often bloodbath matches and somehow come out on top. I enjoyed his run as champion and dare say he was the top world champion from 2000-2010. Even his matches where he wrestled for the world title, notably against Eddie Guerrero at Judgement Day 04 and John Cena at Judgement Day 05, were out of control blood baths. Sure when he came back from an injury he wasn't the same but in 04/05 this guy was untouchable. His promos were awesome as well, just check out on the one on this PPV. I think the dumbest thing he did was invent the cabinet with a bunch of jobbers.Dudley Boys VS Undertaker: Paul Heyman abducted Paul Bearer and put him a glass case and filled it with cement. I think Heyman wanted to manage The Undertaker but I cannot remember nor do I really care. Undertaker wins this decent match and then pulls the lever and show ends with Paul Bearer encased in cement.Overall, there is no reason to buy this PPV. It had some god awful matches that could have been saved for Smackdown. As I stated earlier, it did start the reign of my faviorte world champion of the past ten years but its not enough to own this dvd.

reviewText: This PPV steps forth and proudly represents everything wrong with the WWE these days.Top billing on this card was a recycled Undertaker, magically regressing back to his zombie gimmick in a handicap match against the Dudleys. Since the WWE is focused on 10% pro wrestling and the rest on gimmickry and poorly written storylines, this match somehow was given more attention and production than the actual WWE Championship match. Leading up to this match, you the fan were subjected to some of the most intelligence-insulting material ever put in front of a camera. Apparently, for the past few weeks, the Dudleys and Paul Heyman were holding Paul Bearer hostage in various hotel rooms across the country. Okay. Then, the match itself came down to whether or not the Undertaker would "do the right thing" which absolutely nobody, including the writers had a clue what it should be. Anyway the sad finish of the match included Bearer being "killed" by drowning in a cement filled chamber. Later, to cover their a$$es, the WWE explained that Bearer was in fact not killed, but "suffered severe trachea and chest injuries."Horrible. Just horrrible.Then, there was the JBL/Eddie Championship match. Because it wasn't the main event, the WWE championship was buried. Not that it had any credibilty anyway, since a guy who was dwindling in a joke of a tag team division was given two title shots without earning them. Yeah, he beat Misterio the week before, but still, a wrestler should have to work his way up through the ranks and earn the title shot by winning many grueling matches. But again, because the WWE isn't about wrestling, JBL was given the shot because the tired, old, recycled gimmick in Kurt Angel, the heel General Manager happened to like JBL. So in essence, the WWE Championship isn't about the best wrestler. Its about how clever the GM is at manipulating the playing field according to his personal agenda. And I don't know why anybody would care, especially since it has been done before, many times, by better on-screen characters.The rest of the card was insignificant, didn't change a thing and was on the whole, throw-away.
summary: The WWE should be paying YOU to buy this.

Not sure why 2 men were just standing outside the ring at times though.Charlie Haas vs. Luther ReignsMade about 2 mins earlier. Good ring psychology and some nice spots.Billy Gunn vs. Kenzo SuzukiIt's ok but their feud began 3 days prior.  Gunn teases the crowd with an "almost" crotch chop.Torrie Wilson vs. SableCrap.Hardcore Holly vs. MordecaiDecent brawl.  Should've been no DQ.  Mordecai just disappeared after this.Texas Bullrope Match for the WWE ChampionshipEddie Guerrero vs. JBLGreat old school style match.  This is a very underrated main event.  Good bumps by both men and the false ending is great too.Concrete Crypt MatchUndertaker vs. Dudley BoyzIntriguing concept.  Match pace is uneven but it's pretty suspenseful and the end of the show is shocking!

reviewText: The extra include some interviews, no extra audio or matches.1) John Cena Vs. RVD Vs. Rene Dupree Vs. Booker T - Elimination match for U.S. title - Once your pinned your eliminated until there's only one man. Ok opener. **1/2 out of 5 stars.2) Charlie Haas vs Luther Reigns - Kurt Angle is disgusted with the way former protege Haas's behavior, so Angles new protege is assigned to teach him some manners. Man Reign looks green here, like a Tough-Enough guy or somethin'. **3) Kenzo Suzuki vs Billy Gunn - Kensuke Sasaki! No... It's Suzuki (Yoshi Kwan 2000). Yesh this reminded me like a 90's WWF Wrestlecrap match. Suzuki needs to get a AJPW wrestler as a valet! 1/2*4) Rey Mysterio vs Chavo Guerrero - Crusierweight title - Awesome match! Rey teaches how to sell an injury 101. ****5) Sable vs Torrie Wilson - Yawn. 1/2*6) Mordecai vs Hardcore Holly - Who's writing for Smackdown? Push these 2 but no.. say, Paul London.. or even Moore. *7) Eddie Guerrero Vs. Bradshaw - Cow-bell Rope match for Smackdown Championship - Ok, both wrestler are tied together with a rope and a cowbell in the middle of it. The first wrestler to touch all 4 corners of the ring without being stopped is the Champion! Awesome old-school match that reminds me of a Russian chain match I saw when I was growing up. Really great match with dramatic close calls that keeps the crowd into it. Wrong goes wins but hey that's OK, he won't keep the belt long and Eddie'll win it back, right Vince?... Uhhh Right? Please? ****1/28) Undertaker vs Dudley Boyz - If the Undertaker doesn't "do the right thing" then Paul Heyman will drown Paul Bearer (Undertaker's former manager) with SOLID CONCRETE! Oh No! Can the Undertaker save him? If I knew the future I would've left at the start of this match to beat the traffic. 1/2*Man except for 2 matches this PPV sucked. Easily worth a rental for the bullrope match but definitly not worth buying.

reviewText: With maybe the only exception being the 2008 Bash, GAB has always been a pretty bad event, and the 2004 version is a perfect example.  There are really only two, or maybe three if you're generous, matches worth watching.  I recently decided to revisit this event.. but found myself bored to sleep with it.United States TitleJohn Cena vs. Rob Van Dam vs. Rene Dupree vs. Booker T:This is the one of the only three matches on the card worth watching.  There is a lot of talent here, and they manage to put on a pretty good opener.  There are a couple of awkward moments and some really slow points although.  Cena actually looked decent here, considering this is back when he was allowed to do more than four different poorly executed moves.  Aside from a couple potential missed spots, this one is pretty good.  And as a final thought: if, for some reason, you choose to buy this DVD, make sure you watch this match.Luther Reigns w/ Kurt Angle vs. Charlie Haas w/ Miss Jackie:The whole Kurt Angle-general manager angle was really bad.  If you were fortunate enough to miss this "era" in sports entertainment, Angle was thrown off the side of a 15-foot balcony onto a concrete floor by the Big Show, and magically became new Smackdown GM a few weeks later.  Angle's death-defying experience produced Luther Reigns as his protoge, starting a few weeks before this event.  As for this match, it's nothing too bad, but nothing really good either.  Reigns is stale and slow, and Haas doesn't have much to work with.  Uneventful, yet watchable.  Don't go out of your way to see this one.  Reigns wins with one of the most recycled finishers WWE has ever awarded.Cruiserweight TitleRey Meysterio vs. Chavo Guerrero:I guess we'll move on the something the audience cares about.  Had some pretty good ring psychology, with Chavo working over Rey's knee, but it's nothing you've never seen from these two before, which is disappointing in it's own right.  Although having that said, we don't get any cruiseweight action nowadays, so this might age well.  Rey retains in a slightly above average cruiserweight match.Billy Gunn vs. Kenzo Suzuki:Wow.. who really cares?  Not me.  Gunn never did anything worth mentioning in his 200 year career with WWE and Suzuki is one of WWE's worst hires ever.  There's nothing really wrong with the substance of the match.  I guess give it a look if you care to see it.Sable vs. Torrie Wilson:The first 30 seconds of this match are mildly decent, but then turns in to the typical botch fest that we're used to with most WWE divas.  Missed spots, bad angles, slow pace, and HORRIBLE ending.  Shocked?Hardcore Holly vs. Mordecai:Rather than actually concentrating on this match, I just sat there and tried to decide which one of this guy's gimmicks was worst.  Kevin Thorne or Mordecai?  Pick who you want to see get beat up more, and just watch them whale on each other for about ten minutes or more.WWE Title Texas Bull Rope MatchEddie Guerrero vs. JBL:This is finally a PPV worthy match, and what a match it was!  WWE may have had some low points in 2004, but Smackdown had some very strong main event bookings.  Innovation was key here, and both men gave it their all.  It was a fresh main event that the live Norfolk crowd was really able to get into.  Commendable performance from both, with some really hard shots taken.  This match had plenty of length and creative spots.  This was the beginning of JBL's almost year long reign as WWE champ.  Check this one out.Concrete Crypt Handicap MatchThe Undertaker vs. The Dudley Boyz w/ Paul Heyman:I honestly don't know how I feel about this match.  More of a segment really, as Heyman is in the background running his mouth the entire time.  I didn't really get the whole storyline.. if Taker was "with" them, why is he facing the Dudleyz?  Why is Paul Bearer being buried in concrete?  Despite the weird storyline and lack of a strong match, I was pretty amused by the whole thing.  A weird, yet somewhat predictable ending although.  By no means is this a wrestling main event, but it's a pretty decent dose of sports entertainment.Overall this PPV event is poor.  I don't usually comment on Sunday Night Heat matches, but there is a pretty decent one between Jamie Noble and Spike Dudley.  I don't recommend buying this DVD at all as there are only a couple of matches worth the money spent on buying the event.  Like I said in the intro, if you're looking into any WWE Bash, look into 08, or maybe even 09.

reviewText: <50: Ask for a refund for not only your money, but also your time. [F]50-54: Mediocre & disappointing. [D] (EG: Judgment Day '04)55-59: Average. [C] (EG: Royal Rumble '04 & No Way Out '04)60-64: Worth A Watch. [C+] (EG: Bad Blood '04)65-69: Good event that was worth the money. [B] (EG: WrsetleMania 20)70-74: Very good. [B+] (EG: WrestleMania 19)75-79: Make sure you add this ppv to your video or dvd collection. [A] (EG: SummerSlam '02)80+ : Make sure that the video or dvd is locked in a safe & cannot be erased. Memorable. [A+]JOHN CENA defeated ROB VAN DAM, RENE DUPREE & BOOKER T to Retain the United States Title: Strange choice as the opener. I can see why they did it (to get what was probably going to be a quietish crowd revved up right from the start), but it sort of undermined the importance of the match. Plus, considering the weak middle stages of this card, it could have been better used to space out the bad matches later on. I really didn't like the first 6-8 minutes of this 17 minute match at all. The tornado rules were just wasted. Basically, it may as well have been a tag match. I also didn't like how RVD was eliminated... Way too much over-selling & being pinned after an offensive move is just silly. From there though, it got pretty good. I'm actually looking forward to a Cena vs Booker feud after what we saw in the latter stages of this match. Mind you, I'm hating the F-U finisher more & more every time I see it. It's so weak!!! Match Rating...7LUTHER REIGNS defeated CHARLIE HAAS: Decent 7 minute match here, which is what undercard ppv wrestling should be like. Nothing special, but more than sufficient without taking up too much time. It was pretty much a stock-standard back & forth bout with the stronger & favored wrestler dominating a little more than their opponent. But it was performed efficiently. I'm unsure of his age, but Reigns has potential. Haas could be anything with the correct gimmick & proper use. Luther's 'Roll Of The Dice' type finisher is excellent Match Rating...6REY MYSTERIO defeated CHAVO GUERRERO to retain the Cruiserweight Title: Holy guacamole!!! First 17 minutes is given to these 2 at 'No Way Out'. And now they get 20 minutes. If anything, that proves that the WWE trust Rey & Chavo to get the job done in the ring. And that is exactly what they did here. A great mixture of everything, this was terrific in almost every aspect. If anything, the knee injury to Rey came a little too early & dragged on too long for a 20 minute bout. Also, the psychology aspect of the match was a little unbelievable, as there was no way Rey could do some of the moves he did with a badly injured knee. But that is being way too critical of what was an entertaining, engrossing & intense wrestling match. Now can we get someone else in the cruiserweight mix please!!! Match Rating...8KENZO SUZUKI defeated BILLY GUNN: Now, most people know that I don't overly criticize wrestlers regarding their talent. Hell, in my 2 years writing for LOP, I only have really done it to Rodney Mack, and that was more from a charisma perspective. Well, I've already had enough of Kenzo Suzuki, and he only debuted a month or so ago. I was wondering what he would do to extend the duration of a match on ppv (this match was given 8 minutes). Well, we found out: 2 nerveholds. I can't think of anything worse in a wrestling match. Apart from that, he botches moves, has practically zero charisma & just has no upside whatsoever. Seriously, I can't think of one!!! Whenever he is on my tv from now on, I will either walk out of the room, turn the channel, or continue wondering what the hell that black thing in his mouth is. I almost forgot Billy Gunn was his opponent!!! Match Rating...3SABLE defeated TORRIE WILSON: I never thought a match could make me wish that Kenzo Suzuki came back out, but this one almost did. Absolutely no redeeming features here whatsoever. I am rating it a 1 out of 10 because Sable did a couple of good moves (I can't recall what they were) in the space of 30 seconds. As for Torrie, it's time to keep her out of the ring... FOR GOOD. Botched moves, bad acting, slow-motion wrestling. Folks, it was all here in this one. And just to finish it all off, Torrie was pinned when one of her shoulders was off the match for the entire 3 count. I want my 6 minutes back!!! Match Rating...1MORDECAI defeated HARDCORE HOLLY: I was actually disappointed with this 7 minute match. I thought these 2 might put together something interesting. What we got was a pretty ordinary bout with not much happening at all. There was nothing too bad here, but there just wasn't anything good either. Even the intensity was disappointing. Really poorly booked match which appeared as if it had been thrown together on the night. Match Rating...4JOHN BRADSHAW LAYFIELD defeated EDDIE GUERRERO in a Texas Bullrope Match to Win the WWE Championship: This not being the main event told me 2 things: (1) JBL was going to be our new champ & (2) Paul Bearer was going to be murdered. Decent 20 minute match which was a little too inconsistent at the end of the day. The 'bullrope match' gimmick lasted all of about 2 minutes for me, when memories of standard strap matches quickly came flooding back. Plus, nothing too innovative was done using the rope. Intensity was down from their Judgment Day match, basically making the stipulation useless. Oh, but wait... the stipulation was there to give us the crappy ending where Kurt Angle came out & used 'Instant Replay' to reverse the decision. Predictable & inconsistent. Truth be told, I wouldn't have minded the finish if the referee had just called it correctly. Ok, with enough effort & a sufficient amount of spots. But nothing too special. Match Rating...6THE UNDERTAKER defeated THE DUDLEY BOYZ in a Handicap Match: I'm calling it a 'handicap match', even though I think it was officially called a 'concrete crypt match'. Good God!!! I really don't know where/how to start explaining this. Ummm, first of all, the match (for want of a better word) completely played second fiddle to what was happening on the outside. Heyman kept interrupting the match & this apparently gave all 3 wrestlers an excuse to just stand there & stop wrestling. The Undertaker didn't lie down & the bout itself was your stock-standard 'Taker & Dudleyz stuff. Nothing too bad, but pretty stale stuff with no continuity whatsoever. It's actually really hard to rate this as a wrestling match, as it was so angle-oriented. Heyman couldn't murder Paul Bearer, so 'Taker predictably did. Of course, he only did this after he single-handedly defeated the WWE Tag-Team Champions!!! This isn't what I expect out of a pay-per-view main event!!! Match Rating...4PPV RATING (39/80) = 49Looking at the key, I have basically given 'The Great American Bash' an 'F' grade & said to 'ask for a refund for not only your money, but also your time'. Well, there you have it readers: The first ever WWE pay-per-view that DaveyBoy has failed. There was just so much wrong with this event. Even the little things were done badly. The referees were incompetent, the matches were ordered terribly, botched moves, shock tv, etc, etc, etc... But at the end of the day, quality wrestling will always get a pass on my ratings system. Unfortunately, quality wrestling was not what we were treated to here. Four out of the eight matches received failing grades. Two of them I would not watch again unless I was paid to. Seriously, the WWE really need to look at SmackDown & do something quick. If they don't, I really do fear for the buyrates of the next SmackDown ppv. I seriously cannot recommend for anyone to watch this. I am so glad that it was my brother that ordered (& paid for) this event.
Title: N/A

reviewText: On June 21st, the WWE SMACKDOWN brand relaunced the WCW PPV classic "The Great American Bash", and it proved to be a contraversial night for many fans.Fatal Four-Way Match for the United States Championship:John Cena defend his United States Championship in a fatal four-way match against Booker T, Rob Van Dam, and Rene Dupre, this was an elimination match and there were quite a lot of good strategies from all four as they attmepted to take advantage of Cena's mistakes, and each others.Cena eliminated RVD first by rolling him up into a pin after he had hit a Five-Star Frog Splash, and Dupre was eliminated by Booker T after Cena hit an ackward F-U, Cena and Booer then had an additional five minutwes of god wrestling culminating in Cena gaining the upper hand and eliminating Booker with the F-U to retain the United States Championship.From there, most of the card became filler, Charlie Hass lost to Luther Reins in a natch that was designed as a total squash, Mordecai and Kenzo Sesuki also had squash matches that did'nt draw in any fans at all over Billy Gunn and Hardcore Holly.The matches of the night were still to come though, and with the Cruserweight Championship match, Rey Mysterio and Chavo Guerrero proved why the Cruserweight division should not be considered a joke, thier twenty minutes of techincal counters, reversals, and high flying action woke up the crowd and restored credibility to the Cruserwieght Championship.J.B.L's title victory over Eddie Guerrero in the Texas Bullrope match is, I beleive, was a great decision by the WWE, J.B.L has given the company some publicity with his actions in Germany, and is very entertaining on the mike, but J.B.L should only be a transistional champion, he does not have the in-ring ability to carry the belt for monthsOverall, with the excepiton of the squash matches and the Wrestlecrap-esque main event/angle involving The Undertaker, Paul Bearer, Paul Heymen, and The Dudley Boyz, this card is an improvement on the abysmal Judgment Day PPV and gives the SMACKDOWN brand a new champion and a new, hopefully better, direction.But this card is not for everybody, if you're a Wrestling fan, watch this only for the first match and Rey vs Chavo, if you're an entertainment fan, watch the afore-mentioned matches, the two main events and the Divas match.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is one of the WORST WWE PPV's of all time. A majority of matches were fillers that were thrown together at the last minute with no real storyline or reasoning behind it.United States Champion John Cena vs. Booker T vs. RVD vs. Rene Dupree - It was fast paced between all four & didn't turn into a big cluster. However just like a majority of four way matches, the eliminations happen one after another after another but still, this was the best match of the night behind the Crusierweight Title.Charlie Hass vs. Luther Reigns - This was made one minute earlier based off a backstage segment with Kurt Angle. Nobody had a reason to care about this beforehand & the fact that Reigns is heavily green didn't make the match better either. It was bad.Crusierweight Champion Rey Mysterio vs. Chavo Guerrero - The division is finally back on track after the embarrising storylines involving Jacqueline & Chavo Classic as champion. These two rarely disappoint in their encounters & this was no exception as eventhough WWE was starting to "ground" the crusierweights at this time, they still put on a performance that show the show at this PPV.Billy Gunn vs. Kenzo Suzuki - Kenzo was just another man WWE put on TV because of his size & nothing more since his in ring skills were just horrible & Billy Gunn himself is one of the best tag team wrestlers in wrestling history but just isn't much in singles competition. Another boring filler.Torrie Wilson vs. Sable - These two are only good when it comes to T&A; type matches but they tried to make this a legit wrestling match and it came off poorly (see a pattern here?).Hardcore Holly vs. Mordecai - Follows the same pattern as the Hass/Reigns & Gunn/Suzuki match. It was horrible.Bullrope Match: WWE Champion Eddie Guerrero vs. JBL - This match looks better than it is in comparrison to the rest of the crap they got this night but on it own, I really didn't care for this match as I enjoyed their Judgment Day & the steel cage match on SmackDown tons better than this. Yes it was bloody but a majority of JBL's main event matches have him being busted open so that's nothing special. There was a part in this match that Eddie hits the frog splash off the top of one corner (you have to touch the corner to perform the move) & touches the other three corners which means technically he won the match but they didn't call it while they did a screwjob ending later on which gives JBL the World Title. Again, I just didn't enjoy this match.Concrete Crypt Match: Undertaker vs. Dudley Boyz - What a crappy way to end a crappy PPV as Undertaker for the most part beat up the WWE Tag Team Champions with Paul Heyman running his mouth non-stop for most of the match until the end when Taker won the match & scarred off Heyman & ended up buring Paul Bearer in the concrete himself. Wrestlecrap at it's finest.WWE brought back an old WCW/NWA PPV that had alot of history behind it & delievered the worst show in the history of this event. I suggest you save your money & pass, your not missing anything special.
summary: One Of The WORST In WWE History

reviewText: WWE GREAT AMERICAN BASH 6.27.04 NORFOLK,VAGlad WWE thought to bring back a great WCW event.Opening Match:1. WWE U.S. Championship Fatal 4 Way Elmination MatchJohn Cena (c) vs Booker T vs Rob Van Dam vs Rene DupreeGreat opener with Cena lasting the entire match last elminating booker to retain the U.S. belt.7.5/102. Kenzo wins following a STO to get the pin.4.5/105. Sable vs Torrie Wilson0/106. Mordecai vs Hardcore HollyWhat a rough match.  Mordecai wins.4/107. reviewText: Jamie Noble vs Spike Dudley 4/10- this one was on Heat. a typical smackdown match. it would have been rated lower if not for the shocking ending.United States ChampionshipFatal Four Way Elimination MatchJohn Cena vs Booker T vs Renee Dupree vs Rob Van Dam 6/10- thought this one was a good choice to open with. good, but could have been a whole lot better. slow pace at times.Luther Reigns vs Charlie Haas 4/10- made at the last minute by Kurt Angle. Reigns is slow and boring. Haas deserves better than this.WWE Cruiserweight ChampionshipRey Mysterio vs Chavo Guerrero 8.5/10- excellent match. finally they give the cruisers 20 minutes or more! back and forth intense action. 2nd best match of the ppv.Kenzo Suzuki vs Billy Gunn 3/10- Suzuki is a joke! he is an old school throwback. I dislike Gunn, but he has to carry this match. Gunn looks like Kurt Angle compared to Suzuki.Sable vs Torrie Wilson 0/10- DUD! these 2 can't wrestle. waste of PPV time.Mordecai vs Hardcore Holly 5/10- better than i expected. Mordecai has potential. Holly shows some signs of life in the ring.WWE ChampionshipTexas Bullrope MatchEddie Guerrero vs John Bradshaw Layfield 9/10- an old school idea that works. was expecting a bad match, but this is just as good as Judgment Day. action, blood , back and forth suspense with a surprise ending. why wasn't this the main event? this was a title match. best match of the night.Handicap MatchDudley Boyz vs Undertaker( Paul Bearer sealed in a glass crypt; Undertaker must do the right thing or Paul Heyman will drown Bearer in concrete) 7/10- why was this the main event? should have been the 2nd to last match. Dudleys aren't main event material. ok match but the antics are what gets this at least a 7 rating. must see shocking ending.there are must see parts like interaction between Sable, Billy Kidman, Spike Dudley and Funaki. a must see with Renee Dupree, Dawn Marie and F.B.I. plus Kurt Angle gets caught by Luther Reigns in the dressing room.Smackdown is in need of help. Raw is much superior. Great American Bash is worth seeing for 3 matches; throw the rest away. Smackdown looks like WCW in its last 2 years.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Pretty decent performance by the Smackdown brand.  Most matches were good.1. John Cena vs. Booker T vs. Rene Dupree vs. Rob Van Dam (U.S. Title/Fatal Fourway Elimination)Great way to kick off the show.  But, the match wasn' that good.  I was really excited about this match, but ended up not being that great.  It was pretty slow and very, very sloppy.  (7/10)2. Charlie Haas vs. Luther ReignsThis was Reign's first match on a PPV.  Not a bad match.  Good effort by both guys.  (7/10)3. Rey Mysterio vs. Chavo Guerrero (Cruiserweight Title)This was probably the best match of the night.  These two have great chemistry.  There is a mix of technical wrestling and high flying action.  Very good match.  Not as good as the No Way Out match, but still very good.  (9/10)4. Kenzo Suzuki vs. Billy GunnThis was put on to get Suzuki on the card.  Again, it turned out to be a pretty good match.  Billy Gunn is a good wrestler, but doesn't get the credit he deserves.  Good match.  (7.5/10)5. Sable vs. Torrie WilsonNothing happens.  Who cares anyways.  (2/10)6. Mordecai vs. Hardcore HollyNot bad.  Another card filler.  Good effort again by both men.  All three of the last second card fillers were pretty good.  (7/10)7. Eddie Guerrero vs. JBL (WWE Title/Texas Bullrope Match)Very good match.  Not as bloody as thought it would be, but still very good.  Good spot when JBL pulls Guerrero off the ropes and he lands on the table.  JBL follows it up with a Powerbomb through the announce table.  Great finish.  Very suprising ending.  (9/10)8. Dudley Boys vs. Undertaker (Concrete Crypt Match/Handicap Match)I guess they had to end the show with this match, but it wasn't very good and the ending was predictable.  (7/10)I would recommend picking this up for the Cruiserweight match and the Texas Bullrope match.Overall Rating:  8.5/10
Title: N/A

reviewText: We started out with 4 PPVs in the original WWF to now having up to 29 perhaps when you count both raw and smackdown having their own seperate PPVs and the both brand PPVs like summerslam and the rumble. I say this since this event was the first smackdown double month PPV for the WWE. Not a bad event in itself and brings back the classic from WCW of the name, though you'd think it'd be a Raw thing since everything on Raw seems to make it look like WCW (think about it, where was Steiner, Goldberg, the NWO). Anyways back to this event.Cena Vs Booker T Vs Rob Van Dam Vs Rene Dupree for the US championship- [a pretty decent matchup where instead of one guy getting a pinfall and winning, there had to be only one survivor to win and this match lived up pretty well]Charlie Haas Vs Luther Reigns- [ A pretty good match which sets Luther up for his first PPV so he had to win to build up his hype... oops gave that one away, anyways a decent match]Rey Mysterio Vs Chavo Guerrero for the Cruiserweight championship- [ a great match as we can expect from these guys, we do need more cruiserweights as these are usually worth the PPV alone just to watch cruiserweights fly in the ring]Billy Gunn Vs Kenzo Suzuki [decent match and a good way for passing the torch as both guys had a good match {i'll explain the passing the torch later) ]Sable Vs Torrie Wilson [i'd love to say this was a good match, but really it wasn't. Torrie I still don't see her as an accomplished wrestler since she rarely has a "wrestling" match and Sable rarely has a good match ever since she returned to the WWE. I know she was worried about her implants the first time around but this time she must have implants everywhere since she rarely wants to take a bump anymore. Can't even call this a T&A; match since nothing was really shown... except the worst officiating of a pinfall ever. At least when a special referee hates the person in the ring and makes him lose, its a lot better officiating than what this guy did, he obviously had his mind elsewhere and must of been close to the gutter].Hardcore Holly Vs Mordecai- [this like i said earlier is another example of a passing of the torch match (where all the wrestlers who have been around for a while help the new guys look good so they become the next big thing), the only problem was, this was Mordecais first and last PPV. After this PPV he was like gone back to develpmental. Honestly I thought the concept was pretty good much like this match was, guess WWE didn't agree].Eddie Guerrero Vs JBL in a Texas Bullrope match for the WWE championship- [very good match as since no disqualification so to speak, anything goes. Ending is who you'd think would win, but not the way you'd think he'd win. very good match].Undertaker Vs The Dudley Boyz in a Concrete Crypt match- [not even really a match just a brawl with a shocker of an ending, only thing is, the ending was unjustified since taker only was heel for like a week if that.as I said a great PPV that was well worth the cost of the DVD that I highly recommend to get.
Title: N/A

reviewText: For the first time since WCW, WWE brought back the Great American Bash PPV, making it exclusive to the Smackdown brand and this PPV is described by many as a Great American Letdown but although it had it's flaws, it was okay to some standards1.) Fatal 4 Way Untied States Championship Match: John Cena (c) vs Booker T vs Rene Dupree vs RVD- This was a pretty good match to start off with that featured a fair amount of back and forth fighting between the 4 competitors. RVD was eliminated first, followed by Rene Dupree, and Booker was last after an FU from John Cena with Cena retaining the title2.) Charlie Haas w/Miss Jackie vs Luther Reigns w/Kurt Angle- This was a filler match, thrown together at the last minute in a backstage segment. With Smackdown GM disgusted by Charlie Haas's actions, he booked him in a match against his bodyguard, Luther Reigns. There was really no need more this match at all and was a boring squash match that saw Reigns get the pinfall victory3.) Cruiserweight Championship Match: Rey Mysterio (c) vs Chavo Guerrero- An excellent match from Chavo and Mysterio that was nothing short of exciting. These 2 helped breath life into the Cruiserweight division on Smackdown. Mysterio retains the title with a Sunset Flip on Chavo4.) Billy Gunn vs Kenzo Suzuki w/Hiroko- Another filler match that fans didn't care much about. Another squash match that was basically to put over Kenzo Suzuki who was supposedly booked as a monster heel for Smackdown5.) Sable vs Torrie Wilson- When it comes to the sex appeal for this match, Sable and Torrie get an A. Prior to the match, they tried to hype the crowd for the match by showing them each in separate hot tubs in bikinis. Unfortuantely the match didn't deliver and was rather sloppy and boring to watch. Kicks here, a rest hold there, a few jokes from Cole and Tazz. Sable goes on to win the match after pretending to be knocked out and pinning Torrie with a schoolgirl to win the match. Definitely seen better matches from Sable in the Attitude Era. This was one of her worst6.) Hardcore Holly vs Mordecai- Yet another filler match that was used to take up space on the PPV. This match came about when Holly and Mordecai apparently got into a backstage fight with each other on the previous Smackdown and it led to this 3rd squash match of the evening on PPV. Fans once again were pretty silent throughout this squash match that's won by Mordecai in relatively quick time7.) WWE Championship Texas Bullrope Match: JBL vs Eddie Guerrero (c)- After their last encounter at Judgment Day ended in a very bloody DQ the rematch came in a Texas Bullrope match, a match that was notorious for being used at Great American Bash PPVs in WCW. This match was almost as good as their Judgment Day encounter but doesn't quite outbeat it. Blood is spilled in this match again and the ending is a bit controversial. Eddie supposedly wins the match after touching the last corner but GM Kurt Angle came out and revealed that JBL landed against the corner first which is considered "touching", therefore on a technicality level, Eddie lost and JBL won the WWE Championship for the very first time8.) Handicap Concrete Crypt Match: The Dudley Boyz w/Paul Heyman vs The Undertaker- How this match came about was that weeks prior to the PPV, Paul Bearer was abducted by The Dudleyz at the request of Paul Heyman, which forced Undertaker to fall under Heyman's rule if he wanted to see Paul Bearer again. It lead to this match. Bearer would be locked inside of a Concrete Crypt with Paul Heyman controlling the lever that poured the concrete inside the crypt. If Taker laid down and took a pinfall loss from the Dudleyz, Bearer would live. If Taker fought against the Dudleyz, Heyman would pull down the lever and send the concrete inside of the crypt to slowly kill Bearer.Taker ended up wining and scared off Heyman and went over to the crypt to supposedly save the life of Bearer but Taker had other plans. Undertaker feeling that Paul Bearer was a liability had no choice but to pull the lever and bury Bearer alive in concrete inside the crypt. Because there was controversy surrounding the WWE showing a murder take place on PPV, they announced on the following Smackdown that Bearer was not dead but suffered injuries from being buried in the concreteOverall: This was an okay PPV but didn't make any great impressions for a return to TV. I mean what were creative thinking?? They booked not 1 not 2 but 3 consecutive squash matches on this PPV! Why??? All it did was lower the entertainment quality of the PPV and possibly DVD buys when the PPV was released in stores. I don't really recommend anyone getting this DVD as all of the watchable matches from this PPV are available to watch for free on either Youtube or Dailymotion
summary: An Okay PPV That May Or May Not Fit Your Interests

reviewText: I do like the idea of new ppv's but why didn't they give it to the best brand which is Raw.Only 1 match has been named for this ppv and it could be a good match but only if it is a different type of match. The wwe ppv's are getting better but what happened to table, cage, tlc,elimination matches, ironman and hell in a cells.They were the most entertaining matches but every match now is 1 vs 1 normal matches.The wwe could make ppv's alot better if they add different kinds of matches. The wrestling is alot faster and longer now than it used to be though.JBL vs Eddie Guerrero-This rivalry is heating up and this should be a good match. JBL is better than Bradshaw because now he can concentrate on using his talent in single matches. If JBL chooses a good match type it will save this match.
summary: GREAT AMERICAN BASH is a smackdown ppv-CRAP!!!!!!!!!!

Cena pins RVD, cleanly. Booker pins Rene, cleanly, and Cena pins Booker, cleanly in a bad mamma jamma match.****Charlie Haas vs. Luther ReinzThrow together match, WWE must have needed a filler. Luther pins Hass in a clean outing.**Rey Mysterio vs. Chavo JrRey wins a clean match with a pin over Chavo. This was a great match that they actually gave a lot of time to develop. But different cruisers need to challenge Rey.***Kenzo Suzuki vs. Billy GunnClean match pin Kenzo over Gunn, however, it is a lame fued and Kenzo is boring to watch.**Sable vs. TorrieA horrible match, the ending was seriously screwed up Torrie's shoulder was not ever even on the mat for a one count, much less a three. A TnA match at best but not at it's best. Torrie and Sable are terrible wrestlers. Cole and Tazz can pimp out the SMACKDOWN! Cruisers all they want but RAW has the better Female athletes.Mordecai vs. Hardcore HollyWith a clean pin over Holly, Mordecal utilized the "Razor's Edge" as his finisher. You have just seen the new "Next Big Thing" this bad mother hummer is fixing to rip on his opponets.****Texas Bullrope match for the WWE ChampionshipEddie vs. JBL*****This match should have been JBL's first title defence, but Eddie being the panty waste that he is, took the easy way out at Judgment Day so this was JBL's rematch. Nick Patrick tried to screw JBL at the end but the good GM Angle used the instant replay and the right decision was made.*****Concrete Crypt MatchUndertaker vs. Dudleyz1 on 2Sweet finisher to the best SMACKDOWN! PPV of all time.Taker over clean by pining D'von*****At long last a PPV with all matches but one ending clean.

reviewText: For years, JBL competed in WWE as a member of one of the toughest teams in tag team history - the APA.  However, very few people thought that a successful singles career was in his future.  Those people were wrong.  In the early parts of 2004, JBL revealed to the sports entertainment world that he was a successful businessman outside the ring.  He then used his riches to purchase a white stretch limo with bullhorns on the hood, and began wearing expensive suits.  He broke away from his longtime partner Faarooq and starting a winning streak like no other.  It wasn't long after going single that WWE officials were forced to give him a shot at the WWE Championship.  JBL took full advantage of his opportunity at The Great American Bash pay-per-view when he defeated Eddie Guerrero in a Texas Bullrope Match.

reviewText: United States Champion John Cena Vs. Rob Van Dam Vs. Renee Dupree Vs. Booker T - This fatal four way was under elimination rules and I must say it is definitely one of the high notes of the night. The eliminations neccessarily did not come one after another but there was still quality and solid action between falls. In the end, Cena retains after hitting Booker T with the F-U. Behind the Cruiserweight Championship, this was the best match of the night. 3.5/5Charlie Haas Vs. Luther Reigns - This match came about after a brief run-in between Haas and SmackDown GM, Kurt Angle. Haas is a great mat-game competitor but the bottom line is that, with Reigns still being too green at the time and this match being thrown together at the last minute, the bout came off being a boring and unsatisfying filler. 1.25/5WWE Cruiserweight Champion Rey Mysterio Vs. Chavo Guerrero - With the Cruiserweight division beginning to be grounded around this time, Chavo and Rey went out and simply amazed the crowd with their high flying and quick paced action as they always do. Rey injured his knee early in the match and that gave Chavo the chance to target the knee and make the knee the focal point of the match. But with an injured knee, Mysterio was still able to connect with a couple of high risk maneuvers. This was a great back and forth match for the Cruiserweight Title and without question, the match of the night. 4.5/5Kenzo Suzuki Vs. Billy Gunn - This was a rematch from SmackDown but it follows the same ingredients compared to the Haas/Reigns match. Just a boring and an unsatisfying filler that did absolute nothing. 1/5Sable Vs. Torrie Wilson - When it comes to these two, the only thing they're good for is candy eye and Playboy. They tried to wrestle but it wasn't anymore past T&A.; 0.5/5Hardcore Holly Vs. Mordecai - This too isn't anything special. Again, just a boirng filler. 1/5WWE Champion Eddie Guerrero Vs. John "Bradshaw" Layfield (Texas Bull Rope Match) - The rules for a Bull Rope match is that one competitor must touch all four corners in succession without being interupted and the first to do that is the winner. After coming off a brutal and bloody match at Judgment Day, Eddie and JBL look to make this match even more brutal and bloodier but to be blunt, I did not see this match being good  or near as good to their match at Judgment Day or even their Steel Cage match weeks later on SmackDown. Yes the match is brutal and it's certainly bloody but for me, the match quality didn't do it. The screwjob ending came when Kurt Angle came out and reversed the referee's decision and awarded the WWE Title to JBL. Only to further the animosity between Kurt and Eddie to set up their match at SummerSlam. 3.5/5The Undertaker Vs. WWE Tag Team Champions Dudley Boyz (Concrete Crypt Match) - Boy, this match was terrible from beginning to finish. The non-stop blabbling from Paul Heyman was annoying and the action from the Dudleys and the Undertaker was just not good at all. A very bad finish to a very bad PPV. 2/5Overall, I'm glad WWE brought back the Great American Bash but it was at an embarrassing cost. The PPV was bad and I do not recommend this PPV alone. However, I would recommend getting this in the tag series along with Vengeance from this year at a low or reasonable price if you have any spare cash lying around.
summary: The Bash Returns But Fails To Execute
Title: N/A

reviewText: What is wrong with you? This is undoubtedly the worst ppv of the year and probably the worst ppv since the mid 1990's. Evey single match sucked except for the crusierweight match. Listen to me, you want to see a good ppv, then watch ANYTHING ELSE  except this ppv.The fatal four way match sucked, I hate john cena, rob van dam should have won the match. I was disappointed when he was drafted from raw to smackdown. a disappointing opening.Mordecai vs Hardcore Holly was bad too, this match was made three days prior to the ppv and didn't get a chance for any buildup. Hardcore Holly should be in different types of matches, not title matches like the disaster at the royal rumble '04, but in hardcore fights, his name is hardcore after all.Kenzo Susuki vs billy Gunn is not even worth remembering 5 minutes after its over. Susuki's entrance is weird and that woman who comes in after him is just embarrassing herself. The crowd was obviously dead during the match and who can blame them? Not me.The Texas bullrope match was a really bad match. Smackdown is pretty desperate to get good heels to be the champions, and unfortunately they picked Bradshaw to be the heel. As for the match, it got confusing because the lights on the turnbuckles kept blinking on and off. I thought it would get good after they used the chair but the Smackdown championship match fails again to get excitement in it. Bradshaw wins which probably was the only shocker of the night because I would have bet money that Guerrero would win.The concrete crypt match was exactly what everyone thought it would be, crap. The dudleys turned bad to take on the Undertaker in the main event. Paul Haymen is as annoying as always and prevents the match from getting exciting several times. Not even the big planned surprise at the end managed to capture the excitment they prabably thought would happen.Any other matches that I didn't mention didn't even deserve to be mentioned. They were all really bad. the only good thing about this ppv was seeing the divas in their swimsuits.Overall if you really really want to see this ppv then go ahead, but only rent it. It is as bad as I say it is, trust me.
summary: To anyone who liked this ppv

reviewText: (Fatal Four-Way Elimination match for U.S. title)John Cena(champ) vs RVD vs Booker T vs Rene Dupreea great way to start the ppv i liked this match alot and john cena wrestled one of his best matches of his career.cena comes out on top to stay champ(4.5/5)Charlie Haas vs Luther Reignspretty good match was not a waste of time, haas tried very hard to out wrestle this giant,Reigns wins (3.5/5)(Cruiserweight championship) Rey Mysterio(champ) vs Chavo Guerrerogreat match i loved it! rey never quits even though he has a bad knee injury early in the match many high spots in this match,mysterio comes out with a great victory keeping his title(10/5)Billy Gunn vs Kenzo Suzukithis was an ok match wasnt the best of the night but it is worth watching, Suzuki wins(3/5)Sable vs Torrie Wilsonnot a big fan of women wrestling,torrie got screwed out of the match but both are very sexy!(3/5)Hardcore Holly vs Mordecainot the greatest match but it is also worth watching Mordecai wins(3/5)(Texas Bull rope match for WWE chamionship)Eddie Guerrero(champ) vs John"Bradshaw"Layfielda great match(should have been the main event)i liked this match alot lot of bumps taken by both men used the rope as a weapon eddie goes through a table.JBL comes out on top as new WWE champ(5/5)(Concrete Crypt match)The Undertaker vs The Dudley Boyzthe actual match was pretty good lots of mindgames played on the undertaker,felt bad for Paul Bearer, undertaker wins but still pulls the lever to fill the crypt with concrete.(4/5)overall it was not the worst pay per view and is worth buying

reviewText: This PPV wasnt that bad and wasnt that good either and it will prolly be one of worst ppvs of 2004 list, well here are the matches I rate out of 41)Cena vs Booker vs RVD vs Rene Dupre  U.S Titlegreat opener and great performance by all ***2)Luther Reigns vs Charliewhy Kurt add this match on a PPV, *3)Rey vs Chavo  Cruiserweight Titleprolly the best Cruiserweight match of the year ***4)Billy Gunn vs Kenzo Suskiawful another bad match *5)Torrie vs Sablestill awful and slow and sloppy *6)Hardcore Holly vs Mordeachiwell a couple of punches but still awful *1/27)JBL vs Eddie  Texas BullRope Match  WWE Championshipfinally a good match, better than Jugment Day match ***8)Undertaker vs Dudleyz  Concret Crypt matchwhy this main event, it wasnt that long even but still pretty good **1/2Overall: Nothing more than a decent rental

reviewText: This PPV will not be happening until the end of June, but i put forwed my card a little bit in advanceEddie Guererro v.s John "Bradshaw" Layfeild (WWE title, First blood match)Eddie should get the win, but be cut open alsoThe Undertaker v.s Bubba Ray and D'von Dudley (handicap match)Undertaker will more than likely get the win, but i would like to see the Dudleys get a push and be given the win.John Cena v.s Booker T (U.S title)I dont care who wins, i would like both men as the U.S champRob Van Dam v.s Big ShowIf Big Show is back in time this match could happen. Should be a pretty good match and i will be happy whoever winsRey Mysterio v.s Mark Jindrack w/Teddy LongJindrack needs a high profile PPV match to get him over. A match with Rey Mysterio, and a victory, will do his carrear wondersCharlie Haas and Rico v.s The Bashem Brothers v.s The F.B.I v.s Akio and Sakoda (WWE tag team titles fatal 4 way match)Would like the F.B.I to win but i think that Rico and Haas would retainMiss Jackie v.s Sable v.s Torrie Wilson v.s Dawn Marie (divas special "wear what you want" challenge)The male fans are the winners here.Mordecai v.s Billy GunnMordecai will win and continue his push to a feud with the UndertakerHardcore Holly v.s René Dupree (flag match)Dupree should win, but if Holly loses to a rookie, then he will have a huge cry about it.So if that is the card for The Great American Bash, then i feel this PPV could exceed Judgment Day.

reviewText: John Cena v. RVD v. Rene Dupree v. Booker T  U.S. TitleThis was a very good way to kick off a very good PPV.  Thank god it was elimination.  Cena retains with an F-U to Booker.***Charlie Haas v. Luther ReignsCharlie Haas had to carry Luther the whole way through the match.  Why did he lose to a loser like Luther.  Luther wins with a neckbreaker.  Haas deserves better.***Kenzo Suzuki v. Billy GunnTwo straight matches with somebody carring somebody.  Kenzo somehow wins.  Billy Gunn should have beat his [...], still a great match.***1/2Rey Mysterio v. Chavo Guerrero  Cruiserweight TitleThis was an amazingly decent match.  Almost as good as their match at No Way Out.  Chavo Classic doesn't get involved.  Rey retains.****Sable v. Torrie WilsonThis match was pretty good but the REF lowered its rating.  Charles Robinson counted to three with Torrie shoulders at the ropes.  Sable wins because Robinson is blind.**Mordecai v. Hardcore HollyThis was a good match.  Holly and Mordecai put on a good show just before the two main events.  Mordecai wins in a good match.***1/2Eddie Guerrero v. JBL  Texas Bullrope Match  WWE TitleThe rules of this match were weird but the match was bloody and awesome.  Kurt screws Eddie(big surprise)and JBL steals Eddie's title in a classic.****1/2Undertaker v. Dudley Boyz  Concrete Crypt MatchThis was a great,great match.  Taker & the Dudleys put on a great show.  Taker buries Paul Bearer!!!!  Heyman and the Dudleyz are shocked.  As the show goes off the air Taker goes "Rest in Piece Paul".*****for the ending alone.
